alert.note: Alert for Central Coast Range of Western Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 2:27AM PST until March 09 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow above 1000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, except 3 to 6 inches above 2000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central Coast Range of Western Oregon. * WHEN...Until noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Spotty snow accumulations of up to 2 inches are possible below 1000 feet, especially for wind sheltered valleys and slopes near the Willamette Valley.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Central Coast Range of Western Oregon
